column5: Hey all,  Just wanted to share yet another fantastic outing to the BOQ. Went out on Sunday (I know the report is a little late) and fished the entire day. We got there at 6am and ended at 5pm. I manged to land 10 fish, snapped 2 off and lost at least another 10. 6 were in the 4-5lb range and the other 4 were in the 1-2lb range.  One of the fish that I snapped off must of been a monster!! I couldn't even get it off of the bottom and I was using power pro braided line. We were fishing in 29 FOW using chartreuse and silver pimples tipped with 2 muddlers. The action was non stop. As I write this, I keep thinking about the feeling when you go to jig your lure and your rod stops dead in your hand. You know you have a monster on then!!! What a feeling!!! Anyway, here is a pic of one of the fish that were in the 4-5lb range. As a note to the light hearted, there were no gaffs used and all fish were released :-)
Way to go.Glad to hear you had a great day.And a nice looking eye there.Its alawys a fun when the fishing is good. Dan
Nice fish! Sounds like you had a good time.
Nice looking eye sound like a great day and you are right it is a great feeling when you lift your rod and you have one on  rob
nice one and congrats on a good outing
sounds like a good time to me congrads.  Hawg Hunter
good stuff...that's some good action and some good sized fish   Nate
very nice sounds like you are tuned right into those walleye down there....   if we get more ice I will need to get my butt down there
Great report & nice catch for sure !!!!...lets hope the ice holds down there ...cheers
Granny's all set ta start a fryin'

You made it just under the wire as the ice has broken up in many places and is totally unsafe - bring your boats for this weekend.  We were out Sunday also for a couple of hours and managed one nice 3.5lber on Little Cleo in 25 FOW with a couple muds.
